meanings.definition: Not held back or kept in reserve
meanings.sent1: She showed her unreserve joy by jumping up and down.
meanings.sent2: The unreserve enthusiasm of the children was contagious.
meanings.sent3: His unreserve behavior at the party made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The unreserve sunshine flooded the room with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The unreserve laughter echoed through the house.

meanings.definition: To speak or act openly and without hesitation
meanings.sent1: He decided to unreserve his feelings and tell her the truth.
meanings.sent2: She unreservedly shared her thoughts with the group.
meanings.sent3: The comedian unreservedly joked about his own mistakes.
meanings.sent4: The singer unreservedly poured her heart out on stage.
meanings.sent5: The teacher unreservedly praised the students for their hard work.

meanings.sent1: Her unreserve in dancing made her the life of the party.
meanings.sent2: The unreserve of the crowd at the concert was exhilarating.
meanings.sent3: His unreserve in trying new foods led to some interesting discoveries.
meanings.sent4: The unreserve of the ocean waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The unreserve of the puppy's playfulness brought smiles to everyone around.
